page.title: 02STAFFS POLICE HQ CONT. ROOM
page.content: The Control Room is computerised and manned 24 hours a day.The people who work there are civilian operators.The Duty Officer is in control assisted by a P.C or a W.P.C. The telephone links are internal and external. On the console there are two lights-white for non-emergency and red for 999 calls. They don't have bells because the operators are often speaking to men on the beat and need quiet. All the operators use VHF and are linked to all Police Stations and mobile patrols. All information is recorded on magnetic tape.The Stafford Police are able to communicate with P.N.C (Police National Computer). By the high speed data transmission line, data can be received and shown on the Visual Display Unit in 4 seconds.The data is quite often about the keeper of a car, and whether it has been stolen or not.
